solution_line_template: There are {num_girls} x {girls_primary_fraction} = <<{num_girls}*{girls_primary_fraction}={girls_primary_grades}>>{girls_primary_grades} girls that are in the primary grades.
There are {num_boys} x {boys_primary_fraction} = <<{num_boys}*{boys_primary_fraction}={boys_primary_grades}>>{boys_primary_grades} boys that are in the primary grades.
Hence, {num_boys} - {boys_primary_grades} = <<{num_boys}-{boys_primary_grades}={boys_middle_school}>>{boys_middle_school} boy students are middle schoolers.
Therefore, a total of {girls_middle_school} girls + {boys_middle_school} boys = <<{girls_middle_school}+{boys_middle_school}={total_middle_schoolers}>>{total_middle_schoolers} middle schoolers.
